name: download
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 to copy or move programs or information into a computer's memory, especially from the internet or a larger computer Compare
upload verb
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to access something on a computer, tablet, or smartphoneaccessI tried to access the site, but my browser became unresponsive.downloadI downloaded the software and installed it.uploadI uploaded my changes, and the site went live.retrieveThe data can be retrieved in a fraction of a second.
See more results »
Examples
Buyers can download his latest novel to read on a mobile device.I downloaded their latest album on MP3.I downloaded a patch from their website.The user confirms their order and downloads an applet which asks them for their personal and payment details.Software updates can be downloaded from the company's website.

B1 [ C ] a computer program or information that has been or can be copied into a computer's memory: a free download
[ U ] the act or process of copying programs or information into a computer's memory: All of our products are available for download on our website. Compare
upload noun

to copy programs or information to a computer, usually over the Internet
Add to word list
Add to word list
IT to copy or move programs or information into a computer's memory, especially from the internet or a larger computer, or to be moved in this way: download a copy/file/documentdownload sth from sth Software updates can be downloaded from the company's website. The file will only take a few seconds to download.
[ C ] a computer program or information that has been or can be copied into a computer's memory: The upgrade will be available as a free download for registered customers. Subscribers get the magazine as a digital download.
[ U ] the act or process of copying programs or information into a computer's memory: All of our products will be available for download on our website. Compare
upload
